translated: Jātaka: The Collection of Middle-Length Jātakas🔽The Chapter on Uncommon Things
“This mango, which is beautiful, fragrant, and tasty,
was in the past a mango.
why is it a bitter fruit?”🔽“Mango, your curd-cart is surrounded by a ring of thorns.
The root is entangled with the root,
the branches are intertwined with the branches.
Because of living with the unpleasant,
that’s why it’s a bitter fruit.”🔽The Curd-Cart Jātaka (No. 6)
